mdRecord.dcterms:title: Garden Club of Virginia tree plantings
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Gross, Stephanie
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Bessie Carter, with shovel, and Mina Wood, right, both of the Garden Club of Virginia, helped plant a pink dogwood tree last Friday to honor the late Alden Hopkins, who designed and supervised the restoration of the pavilion gardens. University President John T. Casteen III, center, called the gardens “a source of delight for generations… For this work, we owe Hopkins and the Garden Club a debt of gratitude.”
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Press coverage
University of Virginia
University of Virginia. News Office
